info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 19 at 6:54PM MDT until June 20 at 5:00AM MDT by NWS Salt Lake City UT
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, south winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Winds may gust as high as 55 mph near Lake Point and near the Stansbury Mountains along I-80. For the Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 102.
* WHERE...Tooele and Rush Valleys.
* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 5 AM MDT Friday. For the Heat Advisory, until 11 PM MDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and a few power outages may result. Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.
info.instruction:
Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles and vehicles with trailers. Use extra caution.
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

parameter.value: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MDT FRIDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING
